title: NASA and SpaceX finalize extension of commercial crew contract
summary: NASA announced Aug. 31 that it has extended its commercial crew contract with SpaceX, adding five missions for more than $1.4 billion.

title: Intelsat’s Galaxy 15 mutes payload as it drifts into other satellite paths
summary: Intelsat said the Galaxy 15 broadcast satellite that stopped responding to commands earlier this month shut down its payload Aug. 31, reducing the risk of interfering with signals from other spacecraft.

title: U.S. Space Command calls for investment in technologies for deep space missions
summary: U.S. Space Command's Lt. Gen. John Shaw said 'one of the challenges that we will have as a nation is understanding the lunar environment'

title: NASA, Axiom Sign Second Private Astronaut Mission to Space Station Order
summary: NASA and Axiom Space have signed a mission order for the second private astronaut mission to the International Space Station to take place in the second quarter of 2023.

title: NASA Sets Coverage for Artemis I Moon Mission Next Launch Attempt
summary: NASA is targeting 2:17 p.m. EDT on Saturday, Sept. 3, for the launch of Artemis I, the first integrated test of NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, Orion spacecraft, and the ground systems at the agency’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

title: A faulty sensor may have scrubbed the launch of NASA’s massive SLS rocket
summary: "The way the sensor is behaving does not line up with the physics of the situation."

title: NASA and China are eyeing the same landing sites near the lunar south pole
summary: China and the United States have identified overlapping potential landing sites at the south pole of the moon as both countries ramp up their lunar exploration ambitions.

title: Ursa Major wins $3.6 million U.S. Air Force contract to flight-qualify rocket engine
summary: Rocket propulsion startup Ursa Major announced Aug. 31 it won a U.S. Air Force contract to support the development of the company’s Hadley liquid engine for small launch vehicles.

title: U.S. looking to encourage more countries to join ASAT testing ban
summary: As a second session of a United Nations working group on reducing space threats approaches, U.S. government officials say they’re looking for ways to encourage more countries to back a ban on anti-satellite weapon tests.

title: Chinese megawatt-level space nuclear reactor passes review
summary: A Chinese nuclear reactor for providing power and propulsion in outer space has passed a comprehensive performance evaluation, according to reports.
